          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Rails 5.0 "],
              ["ActiveRecord", [["c"]]],
              [" models inherit from "],
              ["ApplicationRecord", [["c"]]],
              [", rather than "],
              ["ActiveRecord::Base", [["c"]]],
              [". "],
              ["ApplicationRecord", [["c"]]],
              [" is the superclass for all models, similar to how "],
              ["ApplicationController", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is the superclass for controllers. To account for this new way in which models are handled, you must create a file in your "
              ],
              ["app/models/", [["c"]]],
              [" folder called "],
              ["application_record.rb", [["c"]]],
              [" and then edit that file’s contents to be:"]
            ]

            "title": [
              [
                "Rails 5.0 also handles callbacks slightly different. Callbacks that return "
              ],
              ["false", [["c"]]],
              [
                " won’t halt the callback chain, which means subsequent callbacks will still run, unlike Rails 4.2. When you upgrade, the Rails 4.2 behavior will remain, though you can switch to the Rails 5.0 behavior by adding:"
              ]
            ]
          },

              [", or just "],
